intro: Erythroseris, commonly known as the red-flowered erythroseris, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are typically tubular and arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in a fine, fuzzy layer to reduce water loss. Erythroseris species are adapted to drought conditions and are often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
